IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Please see Schedule O.Dana Hall School is an independent boarding and day school for girls in grades five through twelve. Dana Hall is committed to fostering excellence in academics, the arts, and athletics within a vibrant, caring and inclusive community. With emphasis on integrity, leadership, diversity, and service as well as on respect for self and others, Dana Hall provides its students with a unique opportunity to prepare themselves for the challenges and choices they will face as women and citizens of the world.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Dana Hall is an independent boarding and day school for girls in grades five through twelve.
IRS990.Desc: Dana Hall School is an independent boarding and day school, providing education to approximately 480 students in grades five through twelve. Dana Hall is committed to fostering excellence in academics, the arts, and athletics within a vibrant, caring and inclusive community. With emphasis on integrity, leadership, diversity, and service as well as on respect for self and others, Dana Hall provides its students with a unique opportunity to prepare themselves for the challenges and choices they will face as women and citizens of the world.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Endowment is an important asset of the Dana Hall School. Total return to the School in terms of both income and long term growth is considered to be of crucial importance to provide flexibility in the future financial management of the School. The Endowment's investment objective is to maximize its total rate of return consistent with prudent risk-taking, in order, over the long term, to maintain or increase the real purchasing power of the portfolio. The School has adopted a spending policy whereby a percentage of the historical average market value of the endowment for program services and capital needs is distributed and treated as support for current operating activities.

In accordance with Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code, the School is exempt from federal and state income taxes and, accordingly, the financial statements do not reflect a provision for income taxes. These determinations have been reviewed according to guidance in a Financial Accounting Standards Board pronouncement related to accounting for uncertainty in income taxes. In determining the recognition of uncertain tax positions, the School now applies a more-likely-than-not recognition threshold and determines the recognition of uncertain tax positions considering the amounts and probabilities of the outcomes that could be realized upon ultimate settlement with taxing authorities. As of June 30, 2018, the School has no uncertain tax positions that qualify for either recognition or disclosure in the financial statements. The School is generally subject to potential examination by taxing jurisdictions for the prior three years.
Financial Aid 4,679,945. Management fees 100,431. Loss on Disposal of Assets -3,403.
Financial Aid 4,679,945. Management fees 100,431. Loss on Disposal of Assets -3,403.

The School is a member of the Association of Independent Schools of New England (AISNE). AISNE annually publishes a racial nondiscriminatory policy in various newspapers throughout New England for its members.

Dana Hall requires all families asking for financial grant awards to complete a financial aid application. The application for aid includes a completed School and Student Service for Financial Aid (SSS) which is an independent determination of what the family can contribute towards educational costs. The application also includes parents' financial statements, federal tax returns, and W-2s. All financial grant awards are determined on the basis of need and on a racially non-discriminatory basis as determined by the SSS and the Financial Aid Committee using all information obtained in the application. Once the Financial Aid Office receives all financial materials pertaining to the application, the Committee will review each family's request. Consideration for aid is made after a student has been deemed admissable at Dana Hall. Once the award has been given and the student enrolls at the School, the Business Office is given the amount of the award to process against the student account. These funds are part of the School's operating budget and the Business Office produces reports in order to verify against the final financial aid reports to student billing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The terms of service for Trustees was amended to begin on the first day of the School's fiscal year immediately following their election and end on the last day of the third fiscal year following such election.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Members of the School's Corporation ("Corporators") elect members of that body as well as members of the Board of Trustees.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Trustees is the School's governing body with full power to manage the affairs of the School, except for certain limited powers such as dissolution reserved for the Corporators.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The School's 990 is reviewed by the Executive Committee and the Audit Committee with a presentation of materials from the School's auditors. The Executive Committee and the Audit Committee recommends approval of the 990 to the full board which then approves it.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All board members are required to review the conflict of interest policy and sign off on an annual basis. Board members are also asked to complete disclosure forms annually to identify relationships with the School and other interested parties. These forms are reviewed by the Committee on Trustees, and any disclosed relationships are discussed; any committee member who is the subject of a disclosure is recused.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Committee, comprised of disinterested trustees, determines the Head of School's compensation. For other key employees, the Head of School determines compensation based on benchmarking with peer schools in the area.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization makes its financial statements available through the Massachusetts Attorney General's website. The governing documents, as well as conflict of interest policy are made available upon request.
